learning_competency: The learner illustrates and solves problems involving similar triangles.

sections.purpose: This module aims to help learners understand the concept of triangle similarity and identify triangles that have the same shape. It also helps learners learn the different methods used to determine if triangles are similar.
learning_objectives: Determine triangle similarity using SAS, ASA, and SSS.
State the relationship between angles and sides of similar triangles.
Compare two triangles using corresponding sides and angles to justify similarity.

conditions: their corresponding sides are in the same ratio
notes: Similar triangles have the same shape, but they may have different sizes.
This means that one triangle can be larger or smaller, but the shape remains the same.

key_words_and_concepts.definition: triangles that have the same shape but not necessarily the same size
matching sides and angles of two triangles
comparison of two quantities using division
sides that have the same ratio

rules: If one side of a triangle is longer, the matching side in the other triangle is also longer in the same ratio.
Correct matching of parts is important when checking triangle similarity.

SAS_similarity.name: SAS Similarity (Side–Angle–Side)
criteria: two pairs of corresponding sides have the same ratio, and
the angle between the two sides is equal.
SAS_similarity.note: The angle must be between the two sides being compared.

examples.title: Example 1:
solution: The sides are proportional and the included angles are equal.
examples.conclusion: △ABC is similar to △DEF by SAS Similarity.

examples.title: Example 2:
solution: The sides are proportional and the included angles are equal.
examples.conclusion: △PQR and △XYZ are similar by SAS Similarity.

ASA_similarity.name: ASA Similarity (Angle–Side–Angle)
criteria: two corresponding angles are equal, and
the side between the angles is corresponding.
ASA_similarity.note: If two angles of one triangle are equal to two angles of another triangle, the triangles are similar.

examples.title: Example 1:
solution: Step 2: The side between the angles matches.
examples.conclusion: Triangle ABC is similar to Triangle DEF by ASA Similarity.

examples.title: Example 2:
solution: Two angles are equal and the included side corresponds.
examples.conclusion: The triangles are similar by ASA Similarity.

SSS_similarity.name: SSS Similarity (Side–Side–Side)
criteria: all three pairs of corresponding sides have the same ratio.
SSS_similarity.note: The sides do not need to be equal, but their ratios must be the same.

examples.title: Example 1:
given: Triangle GHI (ΔGHI): GI = 4 cm, HI = 8 cm, GH = 16 cm
Triangle RST (ΔRST): RT = 6 cm, ST = 12 cm, RS = 24 cm
solution: The ratio of side GI to side RT: GI over RT = 4 over 6 = 2 over 3
The ratio of side HI to side ST: HI over ST = 8 over 12 = 2 over 3
The ratio of side GH to side RS: GH over RS = 16 over 24 = 2 over 3
examples.conclusion: ΔGHI is similar to ΔRST by SSS Similarity.

examples.title: Example 2:
given: Triangle LMN (ΔLMN): LN = 4 cm, MN = 6 cm, LM = 8 cm
Triangle PQR (ΔPQR): PR = 8 cm, QR = 12 cm, PQ = 16 cm
solution: The ratio of side LN to side PR: LN over PR = 4 over 8 = 1 over 2
The ratio of side MN to side QR: MN over QR = 6 over 12 = 1 over 2
The ratio of side LM to side PQ: LM over PQ = 8 over 16 = 1 over 2
examples.conclusion: ΔLMN is similar to ΔPQR by SSS Similarity.
